intro: Anemopaegma glaucum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped blooms on slender stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting flowers and drought tolerance.
